speaker: Clare
text: How's your coffee?

speaker: Martin
text: Good, good.  Yours?

speaker: Clare
text: Very nice.

speaker: Martin
text: That's good.

speaker: Clare
text: [_then_] Marty, we have no reason to be uncomfortable.  We're two consenting adults.

speaker: Martin
text: What about your husband?  He never consented!

speaker: Clare
text: Stan loved you Martin, and he loved me.  If anything, he's up in heaven right now, watching us and smiling.

speaker: Martin
text: You don't think he was watching the whole time, do you?

speaker: Clare
text: Not if heaven gets ESPN! [_they laugh_] Now, stop feeling guilty.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried_] Oh, Fras'.  You remember Clare Wojadubakowski?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course, hello, Mrs. Wojadubakowski, good to see you again.  Gosh, I'm sorry again about your loss.

speaker: Clare
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: He was a good man, your husband. [_Martin's guilt starts_] Dad's often said if it weren't for Stan, he wouldn't have made it through the academy, isn't that right?

speaker: Martin
text: [_guilty_] That's right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't he lend you the money for your first car?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh course, we all owe him for introducing Dad to Mom.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, God!

speaker: Clare
text: You know, Marty, I think we better go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, well, Clare it's lovely seeing you again.  Em, please give my regards to your son, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, God! _Martin and Clare leave as Roz arrives and sits with Frasier at the table that guilty pair just left._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Roz.  Why don't you join me?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, aren't you here with Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, actually I haven't been seeing much of Niles lately.  He spends all his time with Mel.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that's what happens at the beginning of relationships. [_to waiter_] Can I have a decaf latte, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Yes, and I'll have my usual, thank you. [_waiter leaves_] Yes, I do hope he hasn't forgotten me completely.  We have wine club tonight, I'm sort of counting on him to help me become "corkmaster."

speaker: Roz
text: But you'll still keep your secret identity as Frasier Crane, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Corkmaster's the most prestigious position in our club.  If elected, I plan to have vertical tastings and guest speakers, perhaps even a trip to Portugal where some of the world's finest corks come from.

speaker: Roz
text: I wish I had a cork right now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny, Roz.  You know what, I do hope Niles shows up. You know, Mel has a way of making him change his mind at the last minute.  You know, I think she's a bit manipulative.

speaker: Roz
text: Based on what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know, I've a feeling.

speaker: Roz
text: So you really don't know her that well.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's true.  You know, I really haven't given her much of a chance, I suppose.  I suppose I could put together a little get-to-know-you event, a Sunday brunch perhaps?

speaker: Roz
text: There you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's a good idea, Roz.  Of course, I don't want to make it seem like she's under the family microscope.  You know, maybe you could come along.

speaker: Roz
text: I guess I could.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, and by Sunday you'll be Corkman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cork-MASTER, thank you, Roz. [_laughs_] Actually, I won't know until after the election tonight.  But you know, I'll let you know.

speaker: Roz
text: Or I could just look up into the sky for the cork signal!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very amusing, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: If you win, I'd love a ride in the cork-mobile.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Roz! **DOESN'T EVERYONE HAVE A FIREPLACE IN HIS CLOSET?** _Scene Two - The Montana - Niles'S Dressing Room. Later that evening, Niles is getting ready in his elaborate dressing room (with fireplace) for the wine club as Mel knocks on the door. Niles is dressed in suit and tie._

speaker: Mel
text: [_o.s._] Niles! [_enters_] Oh, don't you look dashing.  I've brought you a nice bottle of Cheval Blanc to impress the wine club.  Mrs. Briggs gave it to me as a thank-you after her last face-lift.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks at bottle_] '61!  I don't believe it!

speaker: Mel
text: Yes, that's what they're saying about Mrs. Briggs!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, this is the perfect occasion for me to bring this wine. We're electing a new president tonight.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and I promised Frasier I'd nominate him.  Oh, did I mention, brunch at Frasier's tomorrow?

speaker: Mel
text: Oh yes, darling.  Well, I'm so happy my rare, expensive bottle will benefit your brother.  Oh, that tie's all wrong, let me.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, of course, of course.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, ever since the day he joined the wine club, Frasier's dreamed of becoming corkmaster. [_she picks out a tie_] Oh, good choice!

speaker: Mel
text: I think it's wonderful.  I really do: helping your brother win this prestigious post.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Frasier, deserves it. _Mel puts on Niles's tie in front of the mirror in order to form a loop as Niles takes his off._

speaker: Mel
text: Because he knows more about wine than you do?

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't say that.

speaker: Mel
text: Well, he's probably been in the club longer?

speaker: Niles
text: No, actually, I sponsored his membership.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, well, so you've never wanted that honor for yourself?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I wouldn't say never.  Who hasn't nursed the dream of one day becoming corkmaster?

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, I'm sure Frasier at least asked if you were interested. [_puts tie onto him_]

speaker: Niles
text: Now that you mention it, no he didn't.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, and you don't resent it?  Well, you see, that's why I love you, because most people would.  I would, bitterly, but then I'm not you and I don't know what's best for you and... now the jacket's all wrong. [_takes it off him_]

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think I should call him on this?

speaker: Mel
text: [_getting another jacket_] Please, the last thing I want to do is come between you and your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: He knows perfectly well how much I've coveted this post. I distinctly confided my aspirations to him the night Jud Riverton fell off the ferry after the spring tasting!

speaker: Mel
text: Well, I'm sure he just forgot.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, don't defend him.  Here. [_lets her put the jacket on_] He's always putting himself first and I always let him.

speaker: Mel
text: Why, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't know, I think perhaps it's because...

speaker: Mel
text: I'll tell you why: because you can't see yourself for what you really are! [_holds him up into the mirror_] You are a powerful, sexy, dynamic, colossus of a man.  In other words, perfect corkmaster.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking at himself_] I am, aren't I?

speaker: Mel
text: And don't let anyone, anyone ever take that away from you.

speaker: Mel
text: Now, that's all I want to say, because I love you and I don't want to meddle. _Mel goes to pretty herself up in the mirror.  FADE TO:_ **GUNFIGHT AT THE BOUQUET CORRAL** _Scene Three - The Wine Club. Everyone is gathered as Frasier beckons Niles over to him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, finally, you're here.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, sorry I'm late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, it's just that the nominations are about to begin.  Now listen, this is what I thought we would do. After you nominate me, I will demure modestly for a moment and then I'll say something like...

speaker: Niles
text: I want to be corkmaster.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a bit artless, don't you think?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no: I want to be corkmaster too.  I covet this post as much as you do, I always have, and I think I deserve a shot at it.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Niles, I've been campaigning for this all week, I was counting on you to nominate me.

speaker: Niles
text: And I will, I'm just hoping that you'll return the favor. Unless that is you're afraid of a little competition.

speaker: Master
text: Can I have your attention?  My friends, as outgoing corkmaster, I would like to thank those who stuck with me during the ugly days of Spritzer-gate, but the time has come to pass the tasting cup.  Are there any nominations? [_Niles raises his hand_] Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: It's a honor and a privilege to nominate my brother, Frasier Crane.

speaker: Master
text: Right, any others?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after some nudging_] Yes, I would like to reciprocate and nominate my brother, Niles Crane.

speaker: Master
text: Are there any further nominations? [_no-one raises a hand_] Well then, a show of hands, please, for those in favor of Frasier Crane. [_they do and he counts - including Niles's proud hand_] Fourteen.  And those in favor of Niles Crane? [_they do - however Frasier does not raise his hand_] Thirteen. [_Niles stares at Frasier until he raises his hand_] Oh, fourteen.  It's a tie.  If only out venerable founder, Virgil Hepplewhite was here to guide us.

speaker: Virgil
text: [_out of nowhere_] I'm over here.

speaker: Master
text: [_crowd moves back_] Oh, sorry, Virgil, I didn't see you. So, em, what is the procedure?

speaker: Virgil
text: [_stands_] Blind taste of five bottles. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Four - The Wine Club. Later on, Frasier and Niles are sat opposite each other at the tasting table.  They are in the middle of sampling a wine.  Frasier spits his out but Niles carries on._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh for God's sake, Niles.  The wine spent less time in the bottle! [_Niles spits and writes down his prediction_]

speaker: Master
text: All right, gentlemen, you have correctly identified the first three wines, let's see if number four can break the tie.  Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: It was ripe, round and thoroughly seductive.  I said Australian Shiraz. [_holds up his card_]

speaker: Master
text: Ah, and Frasier, what did you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, contrary to my brother I thought it was dark, dusky and supple, but I also said Australian Shiraz." [_holds up card_]

speaker: Master
text: You're both right, we're still tied. [_applause_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, this is the moment of truth.  Don't choke.

speaker: Niles
text: Please, prepare to be stomped like a late harvest Gevertstremener! _They take sips of their wine simultaneously, swish it around their mouths in pride, and in rhythm, lift their buckets and spit together. They write down their prediction._

speaker: Master
text: Gentlemen?

speaker: Niles
text: It was jammy, plummy, dense and chewy.  There is no doubt in my mind that it was a Napa Valley Merlot. [_holds up card_]

speaker: Master
text: You, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: A nice big wine with excellent heft.  It's Napa all right, but as I always say, why go Merlot when you can call a Cab? [_holds up card_]

speaker: Master
text: I thought this bottle might trip you up.  Gentlemen, it's actually a blend.  A forty-five percent Cabernet...

speaker: Frasier
text: And?!

speaker: Master
text: And... fifty five percent Merlot!  Niles wins by ten percent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, congratulations, obviously the better man won.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, please...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, don't be modest.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I wasn't, they're starting my inauguration. _Niles sits in a throne-like chair in which he is hailed with the medal of the cork and a song to the tune of "Rule Brittania!"_

speaker: Club
text: Hail corkmaster, The master of the cork, He knows which wine goes with fish or pork!  Hail corkmaster, The master of the cork... _They carry on singing to Frasier's anger as we FADE OUT.  End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Roz and Frasier are in the kitchen preparing brunch on Sunday morning._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, the whole purpose of this brunch is to get to know Mel better, but it just hurts the hell out of me preparing a sumptuous brunch for Niles after the way he betrayed me at the wine club.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, would you shut up about that corkmaster thing!  I already hate you for putting that song in my head! _Daphne enters the kitchen with a Bloody Mary, she seems kind of tipsy.  Reset to: Living Room Meanwhile, Martin enters from his room.  He seems nervous._

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, it's all clear. _Martin and Clare run out and head to the door quickly as she fastens her blouse._

speaker: Martin
text: [_picks up chili bowl_] Thanks for dropping off my tupperware.

speaker: Clare
text: Oh, oh, it's no trouble at all.  I was headed out to church this morning... and I thought, "Oh, Marty's right on the way."

speaker: Martin
text: [_snaps out of it_] What's the matter with us?

speaker: Clare
text: Oh, Martin, we have done nothing wrong.  I mean, maybe we were a little impetuous, but that's no crime.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I guess you're right.  Well, listen, thanks for dropping by, and I'll call you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mrs. Wojadubakowski.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, look who just came here!  Look who it is. [_drags her back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't even hear the doorbell ring, what brings you here?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, [_looks for excuse_] she just brought me back my chili bowl. Well thanks a lot, and I'll see you later.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, where are your manners?  Why don't you join us for brunch, Clare?  I insist.  I'm not sure that we'll be able to give you a treat as spicy as the one that Dad gave you but...

speaker: Clare
text: Yes, he does make very good chili!

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't that flattering, Dad?  You know what, I think someone wants seconds!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, could I see you in the kitchen for a minute?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Clare, you make yourself at home. _They enter the kitchen as Martin greets Roz and Daphne.  Roz is preparing some Bloody Marys._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, splendid idea, Roz; Bloody Marys.  You know, why don't you offer one of those to Clare?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't think she's got time.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll ask her.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s._] Mrs. Wojadubakowski, Mr. Crane was wondering if you had time for a quick one.

speaker: Martin
text: [_agitated_] Look, Frasier, there's something you should know

speaker: Clare
text: we just slept together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?  She just got here two minutes ago.

speaker: Martin
text: She was here earlier.  I just don't know what came over us. We just couldn't keep our hands off each other, we were like animals or sex-crazed teenagers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what's wrong with that?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'll tell you what's wrong with that, she's Stan's widow.  I mean, he didn't even like it when I borrowed his lawn mower!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, listen, Stan's been gone a while now.  I mean, you're not teenagers, you're two mature people reaching out for some companionship.  I think it's adorable. [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Martin
text: Adorable?! _Frasier and Martin enter the main area where Daphne, with Bloody Mary in hand, opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, good morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne. [_looks_] My, isn't that a beautiful outfit.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_falling over herself_] Oh, thank you, Dr. Crane, how sweet.

speaker: Mel
text: [_on cell phone_] So just beep me if you need me.

speaker: Niles
text: Greetings all.  Mel, I think you know everyone.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Mrs. Wojadubakowski, what a nice surprise.  This is Mel Karnovsky.

speaker: Mel
text: Hello.

speaker: Clare
text: It's a pleasure to meet you. [_stands_] Martin, I really have to be getting to church.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, sure, okay.  Well, I'll just walk you out.

speaker: Niles
text: You know what, by the way, I'm so sorry to hear about your husband.

speaker: Clare
text: Thank you, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: I understand Dad's been doing what he can to fill the void.

speaker: Roz
text: Can I pour you a Bloody Mary, Mel?

speaker: Mel
text: Not for me.  It's a little early in the day for hard liquor, don't you think?

speaker: Roz
text: Not anymore. [_pours herself a large one_]

speaker: Mel
text: Niles, let's get this foie gras box in the refrigerator. [_notices Eddie has his head in the bag_] Oh, hello, Eddie. Or should I say goodbye?

speaker: Martin
text: Huh?

speaker: Mel
text: Well, Martin, I'm sure you'll be locking Eddie out on the balcony if people are going to be eating here.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'll tell you who I'd like to lock out on the balcony-

speaker: Roz
text: Oh please, let it be me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, maybe I remind you that we're having this little bruncheon in order to get acquainted with Mel.  We owe it to Niles to give her a chance.

speaker: Daphne
text: I agree with Dr. Crane, we should all have another Bloody Mary. [_pours one_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't say that!

speaker: Daphne
text: It was implied.

speaker: Mel
text: [_enters with Niles a bottle of wine_] Oh, Frasier, I almost forgot.  The corkmaster and I brought this along for you. [_hands over bottle_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, thank you very much, that's a lovely bottle. I guess Niles must have told you about his eleventh hour victory.

speaker: Mel
text: Ah, yes, and I'm so proud of him.

speaker: Niles
text: Let's give credit where credit's due, to Mel. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: To Mel?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yes, it was her idea that I should run.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, perhaps I'll just put this around the corner before the cork flies out and hits someone. _Frasier puts the wine around the corner as the scene DISSOLVES TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Everyone is sat with their drinks at the table.  Daphne has become increasingly drunk._

speaker: Mel
text: So, after all these years of doing tummy tucks and liposuctions, I can look at a fully clothed person and see exactly what they look like naked. [_everyone becomes self- conscious_] I can see every sag, droop, ripple and pucker. It's like X-ray vision.

speaker: Roz
text: How interesting. [_walks to kitchen holding her stomach in_] I think I'll go check on breakfast.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_tensing his muscles_] Let me give you a hand with that.

speaker: Roz
text: When you invited me, did you say "brunch for Mel" or "brunch from Hell"?

speaker: Frasier
text: That woman is unbearable.

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters_] Well, guess who's allergic to Eddie?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord.

speaker: Martin
text: She wants a glass of water to take her pill with. [_fills a glass_] Boy, do you know what I can't stand?  All that "sweetie, dearie, darling" stuff.  I've never met anyone so phony! [_Mel enters_] Hello, dear, here's your water. [_hands it over_]

speaker: Mel
text: Thank you, Martin.  Well, Frasier, I'm afraid I have some bad news.  I just got beeped by my service and I have to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Mel
text: Thank you for brunch though, thanks for inviting me.  It's such a civilized way to spend an afternoon.

speaker: Daphne
text: "With her head tucked underneath her arm/ she walks the bloody tower!" - You know who that song's about, don't you?

speaker: Mel
text: Bloody Mary?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't mind if I do! [_picks up Bloody Mary and exits_]

speaker: Mel
text: Anyway, I better go.

speaker: Niles
text: Darling, I have your coat.  I'll walk you to the elevator.

speaker: Mel
text: Well, thank you all for a lovely afternoon.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's a blessing.  Now we can enjoy our breakfast.

speaker: Roz
text: I doubt it.  I was only allowed to make a cheese-free, mushroom-free, fat-free frittata, thanks to the girl in the plastic bubble!

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I'll order a pizza. [_takes phone into kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I have half a mind to say something to Niles, he is making a terrible mistake with that woman!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: But Dad, it is Maris all over again!  She's dominating him, emasculating him!

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I don't like her anymore than you do and God knows we've been through this before.  I didn't Lilith, we both didn't like Maris and you boys sure as hell didn't like Sherry, but what good did it do talking about it?

speaker: Frasier
text: He's repeating a terrible pattern.

speaker: Martin
text: Well he's going to repeat it whether you like it or not. And if you say anything, you're just going to drive a wedge between you.  So, nobody's going to say a word!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's a shame Mel had to leave.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yeah, you know, we were having such a good time.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I was nervous bringing her over here.

speaker: Niles
text: I was concerned what you'd think, you know, getting to really know her for the first time.  So?

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh, I'm going to go let Eddie in. [_exits to balcony_]

speaker: Niles
text: Come on, seriously, I want you to be totally honest. [_Daphne enters, waiting on the phone_] Tell me, what do you think of Mel?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I don't like her at all, she's bossy and fussy and mean. She's all wrong for you. [_into phone_] Yes, I need a large pepperoni pizza, and some cheese bread! [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_stands_] I'm sure she didn't mean that, Niles. [_follows Daphne into kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that was startling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, don't take that seriously, Niles. [_Roz enters from balcony_] You know how women sometimes just form irrational dislikes for one another.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's great, I leave the room for one second and you rat me out.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's okay, I don't have anything to hide and I'm not irrational.  She's pushy, demanding and a gigantic pain in the ass!  I'd dump her like radioactive waste.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, so that's two of you in the Anti-Mel camp.

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Frasier_] Oh, did you tell him what you thought of Mel too?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Daphne did.

speaker: Roz
text: Oops! [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I just think she's Maris all over again, she's manipulative... I think you're repeating a terrible pattern.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, isn't this neat?!  We all have our individual reasons for disliking her.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad, what's your reason for disliking Mel?

speaker: Daphne
text: So you did tell him what you think of her and after shoving me into the kitchen and shaking your freakin' finger at me! [_NB: this light was greatly delivered by Jane_]

speaker: Martin
text: She's crazy, Niles, I don't know what she's talking about... [_Roz enters_]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, that's all right, Dad.  I, er, I asked you all to be honest and you were. [_gets coat_] I got my answer.  You know what would have been nice?  Is if one of you could have found one nice thing to say about her. _Niles exits and slams the door behind him in disgust.  The rest look around in guilt.  The silence is then cut after about ten seconds._

speaker: Daphne
text: She does have that X-ray vision. _Everyone looks at her as we FADE OUT.  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is sat reading a book as Martin enters and sits in his chair._

speaker: Martin
text: Did you talk to Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Em, I left a couple of messages but no answer.  I think he's gonna have to stay mad for a while.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, that was a hell of a brunch all the way round for you as well as me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, if you're talking about what happened between you and Mrs. Wojadubakowski, you have nothing to be ashamed of.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, I guess.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you're going to see her again?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't know, I don't think it's gonna work out.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not still feeling guilty, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: No, what you said made a lot of sense.  It's just that I think it's run its course.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I have a theory.

speaker: Martin
text: Geez!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Daphne enters and hears_] No, no, hear me out.  I think by giving you my approval to sleep with Clare I've made it less exciting for you.  There was a certain illicitness to the relationship that gave it a kind of piquancy.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, it's Sunday, take the day off!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_the drink has obviously worn off_] Wait, Mr. Crane.  You slept with Mrs. Wojadubakowski?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, I did, isn't that adorable?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it's disgusting, you dirty old man!  Sleeping with that poor widow before her husband's even cold in the ground.

speaker: Martin
text: You think that was wrong?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're damn right I do.  You ought to be ashamed.

speaker: Martin
text: See, I told you, Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: We live in a civilized society and there are certain rules we have to live by. [_getting carried away as if settling a mental conflict_] We all have impulses we'd like to explore, but we don't!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_after a pause she tries to put it aside_] Well, we can't just go chasing anyone you fancy just because you're suddenly attracted to them.  There are certain things you don't do, no matter how tempted you are. [_exits to her room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Boy that was strange, wasn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't think it was strange at all!  Made a lot of sense to me! [_stands and gets coat_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Where the hell are you going?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I better get over to Clare's and apologize.  Don't wait up for me Frasier, I've got a lot of apologizing to do! _Frasier gives him a look as he exits.  End of Act Two._
